42
REASONS FOR DISINHERITANCE
(1) A testator may disinherit an heir who has a right to a statutory portion when the heir in question:
has, by breaking a legal or moral obligation, seriously wronged the decedent;
has intentionally committed a serious punishable offence against the testator or his or her spouse, child, adoptive child or parent;
has succumbed to idleness and a life of dishonesty.
(2) Disinheritance may be complete or partial.
